TopicTitle: LLL - Lack Luster Labs - Development Thread

Articles.Content: Gorgeous, Lack!

message snippage

http://i.imgur.com/d8ahw8q.png

Oppsie.

that had me ROFLMAO Lack nice one reminds me of the time my command pod somehow landed upside down due to some weirdness with two radial parachutes. I look forward to the new parts you have as they look really nice!

that had me ROFLMAO Lack nice one reminds me of the time my command pod somehow landed upside down due to some weirdness with two radial parachutes. I look forward to the new parts you have as they look really nice!

http://i.imgur.com/LyOgP6V.png

Hehe. I suspect I would have to write something along the lines of 'Out of Bounds Lateral Velocity' in the accident report for that one.

Anyway, made a larger passenger cabin that has a crew hatch. Not sure if the 15' displacement between the cockpit's flight deck and the passenger cabin annoys me or not.

Edit:

And a tail part (instead of the fire-spitter bomber tail from before)

Edit:

Latest:

SXT-Alpha-0-2.zip

Edited January 25, 2014 by Lack
Hmm, so you're moving more into airplane parts now. Interesting.

Hmm, so you're moving more into airplane parts now. Interesting.

It's more about seeing how far I can push a pack with just using the stock part's textures, and the stock aero-space section could do with a bit of fleshing out. Trying to make a foil-coated probe-core at the moment,
Might I request cargo bays? I always want cargo bays!

Might I request cargo bays? I always want cargo bays!

I'm sure I can manage that.

Finished the probe.

Carries a little bit of Xenon as well.

Also, I believe the texture reduction packs were rendered obsolete by one of the recent Active Texture Management releases.

Edited January 26, 2014 by Lack

Hey Lack, any notice on when you'll be updating the LLL pack?

If not, can anybody tell me what I need to add to have the cargo bay doors open and close in the editor?

Also, I like your venture into planes. Keep it up!

Hey Lack, any notice on when you'll be updating the LLL pack?

If not, can anybody tell me what I need to add to have the cargo bay doors open and close in the editor?

Also, I like your venture into planes. Keep it up!

Thank you. I'll be leaving LLL for a bit, most of what's left to do is squishing bugs like that f'ing rescale on reload bug.

You'll need to grab the Firespitter .dll and use the animation module from that and do it the same way B9 does. That or write a plugin yourself.

As I've said a few times now, the tweakables are dependent on the type of module (e.g. landing gear), they didn't get tweakables properly finished in .23 so you can't add it via config (Although, you could perhaps hook the animation into the landing gear module). Well, at least as far as I'm aware.

Edited January 26, 2014 by Lack

Thank you. I'll be leaving LLL for a bit, most of what's left to do is squishing bugs like that f'ing rescale on reload bug.

You'll need to grab the Firespitter .dll and use the animation module from that and do it the same way B9 does. That or write a plugin yourself.

As I've said a few times now, the tweakables are dependent on the type of module (e.g. landing gear), they didn't get tweakables properly finished in .23 so you can't add it via config (Although, you could perhaps hook the animation into the landing gear module). Well, at least as far as I'm aware.

Would this be the animation module in question?



    MODULE
    {
        name = FSanimateGeneric
        animationName = Cargo_A_Toggle
        startEventGUIName = Close cargo bay doors
        endEventGUIName = Open cargo bay doors
        toggleActionName = Toggle cargo bay doors
        availableInEVA = True
        EVArange = 10
    }

Taken from the B9 cargo hold.

Do I just replace your module


MODULE
{
	name = ModuleAnimateGeneric
	animationName = cargodoor
	isOneShot = false
	startEventGUIName = Close Doors
	endEventGUIName = Open Doors
}

With it? Putting in the "cargodoor" in the animationName.

You know what... I'm just gonna try it.

Edit: Yep. Seems to have worked...

Edited January 26, 2014 by BananaDealer

New craft that i made, almost looks like a SU-## forgot the exact number but the one that this looks a lot like. I have trouble with that stupid infinite glider/ infinite speed bug thing unless the front wingy bits are disabled for all three directions, and the roll removed from the main wings, It has 2 SAS in the front that can easily roll the craft and I'm thinking of removing the roll from the last wing also. Sitting on the runway this plane is already at a 10 degree tilt and leap off the ground at a mere 20-30m/s surface speed and a few meters of runway. It is quite stable with SAS off, but I have it on as it help when this noob flies.

Stats: To be added in later.

Edit: Yep. Seems to have worked...

Glad to hear it worked, added it to the FAQ in the op.

New craft that i made, almost looks like a SU-## forgot the exact number but the one that this looks a lot like. I have trouble with that stupid infinite glider/ infinite speed bug thing unless the front wingy bits are disabled for all three directions, and the roll removed from the main wings, It has 2 SAS in the front that can easily roll the craft and I'm thinking of removing the roll from the last wing also. Sitting on the runway this plane is already at a 10 degree tilt and leap off the ground at a mere 20-30m/s surface speed and a few meters of runway. It is quite stable with SAS off, but I have it on as it help when this noob flies.

Very nice. I've had the same problems with infi-gliding, makes landing a bit interesting. Luckily the firespitter propeller has a reverse thrust setting. I'm going to try my hand at a stock propeller, I reckon I might be able to get it to work with the new engine module.

Got another request for you, Lack, if it's okay.

I designed another pod for the Eagle - this is based on the Science/Booster Pod from Season 2.

And I was wondering if you could do something similar for this that was done for the Eagle Passenger Pod - meld the pieces together. I tried with Ubiozur's Welding and... gack. Something really screwy happens to LLL pieces when you try that. No matter what you do, the pieces seem to want to rotate 90 degrees the WRONG direction as they're being welded. Just doesn't work.

I'd like this basic shape - without the windows I might add.

Also - just a suggestion: Have you considered adding new IVAs to parts like the square module hulls? The Hitchhiker IVA is functional. But obviously doesn't actually fit inside the LLL Pieces that allow Kerbals to reside, except for maybe the big 4x4 parts. ( I use the Kerbal Manifest system). Would be nice to have an LLL themed Passenger IVA.

How about science lab capability? There's a big science processor lab in the Squad stock parts. But it'd be nice to be able to use that functionality with LLL parts instead of lugging that big thing around.

Love the new aero parts! Particularly the small ones. I've never seen anyone try to make cockpit pods for that small scale before. That's really useful!

Glad to hear it worked, added it to the FAQ in the op.

YAY! I'm helping!
lack, can you release the latest SXT version with the 0.625 tail?
I'd like to inform you that you have a typo in your title, sir.

lack, can you release the latest SXT version with the 0.625 tail?

It'll be released this evening, patience. Well, I plan to, I've got relatives coming over for dinner so it'll depend on what time that finishes and how long it'll take to clean up.

@Kvick,

That aimed at me/thread title? I corrected it to the Commonwealth spelling rather than the Americanised one, not sure which way round I prefer it. I'll likely umm and arr about it for a bit then change it back.

@Logan,

I'm sure I can manage that. It's not too hard to do once you get your head round the co-ordinates.

As for IVAs, given that the last one I attempted almost resulted in my computer being defenestrated, I'm sworn off them for the time being. Science lab might be tricky, last time I tried to add the module to a part it would cause the game to crash on load, I haven't revisited it.
